Exhibits and Louisville-area galleries

The Courier-Journal 11:32 a.m. EST November 21, 2014

“Lake Edge,” oil on panel by Steven Walker, is part of “Simply Louisville” at B. Deemer Gallery.

CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

21c Museum Hotel. 700 W. Main St. "Transporting Transformation: Cuba, In and Out," by Jose Toirac, Sandra Ramos and others; "Chito Yoshida: Love for Sale," by Chito Yoshida; "A Thirsty Switch Still Quivers For Me," by Gina Phillips. "Burnouts," by Julia Christensen. All end April 2015. (502) 217-6300.

Actors Theatre of Louisville Gallery. 316 W. Main St. "Kentucky Watercolor Society: Aqueous USA 2014," 37th annual juried exhibition. Ends Dec. 23.

The Arts Council of Southern Indiana. 825 E. Market St. "The Party in My Head," by Kent Epler. Ends Jan. 10.

Asia Institute Crane House. 1244 S. Third St. "Poking the Lillies Pad," ceramic works by nationally recognized, emerging Asian American artists. Ends March 15, 2015.

B. Deemer Gallery. 2650 Frankfort Ave. "Simply Louisville," by Steven Walker. Ends Dec. 17.

COURIER-JOURNAL

Critic's Picks | Visual arts

Bridge Gallery. Mellwood Art Center, 1860 Mellwood Ave. "Seasons," by Carol Labashosky. Ends Dec. 15.

Carnegie Center for Art & History. 201 E. Spring St., New Albany. "Earth-Tones: Art Quilts," by Penny Sisto. Ends Jan. 10.

Conrad-Caldwell House Museum. 1402 St. James Court. "Louisville's River." Ends May 31, 2015.

Filson Historical Society. 1310 S. Third St. "Steamboating on Western Waters." Ends Dec. 30. (502) 635-5083.

Frazier History Museum. 829 W. Main St. "Lifestyles of the Rich & Famous: Art, Fashion & Luxury During the Gilded Age." Ends Feb. 1. "Irving Berlin's White Christmas: The Exhibit." Ends Jan. 11. Opening Friday, "Holidays Around the World," display of trees, lights and traditional holiday objects. Ends Jan. 4.

Gadabout Gallery and Artisan Shoppe. 249 Spring St., Jeffersonville. "Gifted: 50 Artworks Under $50." Ends Nov. 30.

Galerie Hertz. 1253 S. Preston St. Opening today, "Architectoplyast: Debrided Surfaces," by Jim Doiron. Reception today, 1-4 p.m. Ends Jan. 3.

Gallery Janjobe. Mellwood Arts Center, 1860 Mellwood Ave. "Presents! Presents!," one-of-a-kind gifts by gallery artists and guest artists. Opens Tuesday. Reception Friday, 6-9- p.m., during all-day FAT Friday Trolley Hop. Ends Dec. 24.

The Gallery at Mann and Fox. Professional Towers, 401 Dupont Circle, Suite 505. "The Art of Embroidery," by Bette Levy. Ends Dec. 31.

Garner Narrative Contemporary Fine Art. 642 E. Market St. "Deconstructing Melancholy," by Aleksandra Stone. Ends Friday.

The Green Building. 732 E. Market St. "Incommunicado," a three-dimensional exhibit by Amy Chase, Patrick Donley and Brad White. Ends Friday.

Heart Gallery. 902 E. Washington St. "Core Constellation," by Amy Stephens McClain. Ends Friday.

Horseshoe Gallery. Horseshoe Casino, 11999 Casino Center Drive, Elizabeth, Ind. "Delectable." Ends Dec. 31.

Huff Gallery. Spalding University, 853 Library Lane. "Ligne Rouge." Ends Dec. 19.

Jane Morgan Gallery. 4838 Brownsboro Center. "Paths in Nature." Ends March 14, 2015.

Jeffersontown Historical Museum. 10635 Watterson Trail. Historic photos and artifacts. Ends Dec. 19.

Kaviar Forge & Gallery. 1718 Frankfort Ave. "Abstract in Kentucky." Ends Jan. 3.

Kentucky Derby Museum. 704 Central Ave. "Horse Play," highlighting the playful side of the Kentucky Derby and featuring historical equine toys, digital interactives and music created for the museum. Ends Dec. 31. (502) 637-1111.

Kentucky Fine Art Gallery. 2400-C Lime Kiln Lane. Works by Jaime Corum, Lynn Dunbar, Robert Halliday and David Schuster.

Kentucky Science Center. 727 W. Main St. "The World We Create." Permanent exhibit that explores science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) through collaborative and open-ended challenges.

Kentucky Watercolor Society Gallery. 4836 Brownsboro Road. "Celebrating the Season in Watercolor." Ends Jan. 31.

Kore Gallery. 1860 Mellwood Ave. Works by Thom Eckert. Ends Wednesday.

Local Speed. 822 E. Market St. "Remix: Stephen Paul Day, Sibylle Peretti, The Leight Collection." "Color Me Justice," works created by students from Maryhurst Academy. Both end Feb. 21.

Louisville Free Public Library. 301 York St. "Black Freedom, White Allies and Red Scare: Louisville, 1954." Ends Saturday.

Louisville WaterWorks Museum. Louisville Water Tower, 3005 River Road. "Making It Move: Steam, Gravity & Electricity," a display of photographs, film and facts highlighting Louisville Water's history of power. Ends Wednesday.

Metro Hall. 527 W. Jefferson St. "Infinite Perspectives," by Ann Stewart Anderson, Ashley Brossart and Dhamin Jassim. Ends Jan. 16.

Paul Paletti Gallery. 713 E. Market St. "Small Worlds," photographs by Margaret Oechsli. Ends Dec. 29.

Peyton Samuel Head Family Museum. Oldham County History Center, 106 N. Second St., La Grange. "I Pledge Allegiance: Honoring Our World War II Veterans." Ends March 22, 2015.

Portland Museum. 2308 Portland Ave. Works by Julius Friedman. Ends Dec. 23.

Pyro Gallery. 909 E. Market St. "Esthesia," by Carrie Burr, Paula Keppie and Wendi Smith. Ends Dec. 27.

Revelry Boutique Gallery. 742 E. Market St. "Louisville Noir," photographic portrait series by Tom LeGoff. Ends Dec. 4.

Swanson Contemporary. 638 E. Market St. "En el Espirtu de Frida," honoring the 60th anniversary of the death of the great Mexican painter Frida Khalo. Works by Pilar Acevedo, Diane Khalo, Joe McGee, Mari Mujica and Jacque Parsley. Ends Jan. 3.

Tim Faulkner Gallery. 1512 Portland Ave. "Lines" a new collection of oil paintings by Jen Goodell. Ends Dec. 14.

University of Louisville's Cressman Center for Visual Arts. 100 E. Main St. "The Sardonic Eye: Bob Lockhart in Context." Ends Dec. 24.

Wayside Expressions Gallery. Wayside Christian Mission, 120 W. Broadway. "Colors," by Creative Diversity Studios. Ends Dec. 2.

Zephyr Gallery. 610 E. Market St. "Project 5: Stranger Than Function." Ends Dec. 20.

Send information about arts events and exhibits to listings@courier-journal.com. The deadline for the Dec. 7 Arts section is Friday.
